content.question: Three identical disks are initially at rest on a frictionless, horizontal table with their edges touching to form a triangle, as shown in the top view above. An explosion occurs within the triangle, propelling the disks horizontally along the surface. Which of the following diagrams shows a possible position of the disks at a later time? (In these diagrams, the triangle is shown in its original position.)

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each shows a tabletop with three disks, and a dashed equilateral triangle with a vertex at the center and the edge opposite the vertex to the left of center and vertical. Choice A has one disk at the center of the table, and the other two disks directly to the left of the first disk with their centers along a vertical line and their edges touching.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows a tabletop with three disks, and a dashed equilateral triangle with a vertex at the center and the edge opposite the vertex to the left of center and vertical.  Choice B has one disk at the center of the table, and the other two disks to the left of the first disk with their centers along a vertical line, with one disk above the midline of the table and the other the same distance below the midline.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows a tabletop with three disks, and a dashed equilateral triangle with a vertex at the center and the edge opposite the vertex to the left of center and vertical. Choice C has disks at the two vertices of the equilateral triangle that are not at the center of the table, and the third disk is directly to the right of the center.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows a tabletop with three disks, and a dashed equilateral triangle with a vertex at the center and the edge opposite the vertex to the left of center and vertical. Choice D has one disk directly to the right of the center of the table, and the other two disks to the left of the triangle with their centers along a vertical line, with one disk above the midline of the table and the other the same distance below the midline. Each disk is the same distance from the closest vertex of the triangle.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows a tabletop with three disks, and a dashed equilateral triangle with a vertex at the center and the edge opposite the vertex to the left of center and vertical. Choice E has one disk directly to the right of the center of the table, and the other two disks to the left of the triangle with their centers along a vertical line, with one disk above the midline of the table and the other the same distance below the midline. The disk on the right is farther from the triangle than the two disks on the left.
